segments.text: Ugh, what a messy kitchen—water everywhere from that overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's just running, no one bothering to turn it off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring down the cabinet doors, soaking everything in sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's standing right there, foot in the puddle, drying a stupid plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She must be blind not to notice the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are making it worse, climbing for cookies like animals.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's stool is tipping, hand shoved in the jar—greedy little thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cookies crumbling everywhere, probably, with that reach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's begging with her hand out; it's all so tacky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is neat, but inside it's a pigsty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water damage, slippery floors— this place is gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how careless they all are.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those open cabinets just invite more trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
